results.title: Daddy long legs (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Jean Negulesco, Samuel G. Engel and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A remake of the 1931 film, but greatly expanded to allow for the dancing of Fred Astaire and Leslie Caron. The story is that of a French orphan whose schooling is sponsored by an American millionaire, on the stipulation that she will never know who he is. His secretary (Thelma Ritter) is so touched by her letters of gratitude, delivered by the school, that she persuades him to visit. He is then enchanted by the elegant, lovely girl and falls in love with her - and she with him, without knowing who he is. The film contains a wide range of music including a jazz with drums by Astaire, a ballet danced by Caron, several dream sequences with Astaire imagining himself as a playboy and a rich cowboy, and Johnny Mercer’s memorable song ‘Something’s Gotta Give’.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jean Negulesco, Samuel G. Engel and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation

results.title: My Friend Flicka
results.creator_credit: Harold Schuster, Ralph Dietrich and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A young boy is determined to befriend a rebellious horse in this touching family film based on the celebrated novel by Mary O’Hara. Setting his heart on winning Flicka’s confidence and ultimately taming her, Ken begins to grow up a little and everyone learns some important lessons in this poignant tale of love, patience, faith and ‘hope beyond hope’. Stars Roddy McDowall and Preston Foster.

results.title: Dad and Dave come to town
results.brief_description: The third film in Cinesound’s ‘Dad and Dave’ series, this film had virtually nothing in common with the Steele Rudd stories and instead was based upon one of Ken Hall’s favourite comic formulae of the ‘fish out of water’. The Rudd family are taken from their usual rural haunts to the city when Dad unexpectedly inherits a women’s fashion emporium. Cast includes Bert Bailey, Shirley Ann Richards, Peter Finch, Fred MacDonald, Billy Rayes, Alec Kellaway, Sidney Wheeler, Connie Martyn, Ossie Wenban, Valerie Scanlan, Muriel Flood, Leila Steppe, Marshall Crosby, Cecil Perry, Billy Stewart, Marie D’Alton and Leslie Victor.

results.title: Dad and Dave: on our selection
results.creator_credit: George Whaley, Bruce Davey, Anthony Buckley, AFFC, Anthony Buckley Productions and ICON
results.brief_description: Steele Rudd’s classic Dad and Dave stories represent what is both noble and comic in colonial society. The Rudd’s are a loud, unconventional farming family, ekeing out a living in the harsh conditions of the bush with little respect for authority. Stereotypical “fair dinkum Aussies”, Dad’s blustering and Ma’s stoicism hold the family together. This film features the talents of an all-star cast including Leo McKern, Dame Joan Sutherland, Geoffrey Rush, Ray Barrett, Nicholas Eadie, Noah Taylor and Barry Otto, with songs and music by Peter Best.
results.creator_credit_for_label: George Whaley, Bruce Davey, Anthony Buckley, AFFC, Anthony Buckley Productions and ICON

results.title: Jack and the beanstalk
results.brief_description: A musical version of the very much loved classic fairytale combining live action with animation. Stars Gene Kelly as Jeremy Keen, a peddler who trades his magic beans for Jack’s cow, Bobby Riha as Jack, and Ted Cassidy as the voice of the giant. A wonderful blending of live actors with animated cartoon characters. Also stars Marian McKnight as Princess Serena.

results.title: Mr Bump
results.creator_credit: Terry Ward, Trevor Bond and Animation Flicks Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mr Men”.
An animated film based on the “Mr. Men” books by Roger Hargreaves. “Mr Bump” is the story of a little man who continuously bumps into things and causes accidents. But one day he finds a job that perfectly suits his unfortunate habit.

results.title: Mr Strong
results.creator_credit: Terry Ward, Trevor Bond and Animated Flicks Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mr Men”.
An animated adaptation of Roger Hargreaves book of the same title. Mr Strong, as his name suggests, demonstrates his physical prowess.
